Previous: vajNext: vaṇṭ

√vañc 'move crookedly'

present: [1.] váñcati  váñcate  

perfect: vavañca  vāvakre  

[aorist: vacyāt  avavañcat  avañcīt  vañciṣyati  vañcitā  vañcitvā  ]

secondary: passive: vacyáte etc. V.+   -- intensive: vanīvañc-  avāvacīt?   -- desiderative: vivañciṣa-   -- causative: vañcayati etc. U.+  vañcayate etc. E.+  vañcyate E.+  

derivatives: vañcaka E.+  vañcana V.+  vañcanīya E.+  vaṅkú RV.  váṅkri V.+  vakrá AV.+  vákva RV.  vákvan RV.  vañcayitṛ C.  vañcayitavya E.+  

It is hardly necessary to assume a different root-form vak for a part of these forms, since they are all such as sometimes show a guttural in place of a palatal of the root.
